145905876.review:
An Exceptional Indie Gem!

This indie game truly stands out in the gaming landscape. Despite the limitations typically associated with indie developers, it manages to deliver a captivating and well-constructed story.

The combat mechanics are not only enjoyable but also provide a satisfying level of challenge. Admittedly, there are moments when it can become a tad repetitive, but this doesn't deter from the overall experience.

The icing on the cake is undoubtedly the exhilarating boss fight at the game's climax, which adds a thrilling crescendo to the adventure.

The game's atmosphere is nothing short of delightful, creating an immersive world that draws players in from start to finish.

One minor drawback is its brevity, but this can be attributed to the constraints that indie developers often face when it comes to resources. Nevertheless, the game manages to make the most of its available assets and delivers a memorable gaming experience.

127917915.review:
*Played the game with Proton*

TL;DR: Great Game for free, which provides ~1-2 hours of fun

This Game was great to play (especially for free) and i also really like the art-style and world-setting, but still had some issues with it:
- The Final Boss can spawn many objects (the orbs), which use WAY to much memory (game can spike at ~9GB RAM while those are active) and have to restart the game to not lag anymore once a swap starts happening
- I had out of some reason glitched through the door in Chapter 1 and could not get back out again (had to reset)
- In the final boss, i had somehow managed to "warp" though the edges and fall to the void, which was a insta-death
- It is not quite clear where a enemy can be hit while doing damage
- The game is missing graphical settings (like capping the FPS, changing resolution and changing the Anti-alias effect)
- Text (especially voice subtitles) seem to be blurry, which i think is related to the absence of Anti-Alias Settings
- Game was short, whished there was more (literally just 2 chapters, [spoiler]one of which is the final boss[/spoiler])
- Controls are not rebindable and the tutorial can be too easily skipped (i had multiple times skipped the tutorial voice subtitles because of playing around with the controls, and the explanation was just in the voice subtitles, no prompts)
- Text translation was pretty OK, but could have been better

Even with the mentioned issue above, the game played smoothly (except the mentioned memory issue) and gameplay was fluid.

Played on:
- Proton 7.4-4
- Manjaro KDE Wayland (Kernel: 6.0.8-1)
- GPU: AMD Vega 64
- CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 5800X

123947394.review:
Simple in terms of what the game offers but considering that it was developed as school project (I would have never guessed this is a school project... it too good to be a school project and has a lot of care and passion). 

The game is worth a play (less than 1 hour max 2 hours), first of maybe its just me but I felt a Honkai impact 3rd vibe from this game at least I can find similarities or at least inspiration from Honkai, I might be mistaken but I do think that the team behind this game made a very through research and knew exactly what they were going for.

Now the game story is simple you play as Maya who has support from Max (who is a chip), as a 3d artist I had a god laugh from that or at least a chuckle as the main boss and enemy is Blender (it aged like a good wine). The world and humanity got conquered by AI and the only thing that can save Humanity is Maya.
Because it is such a short game you don't really attach yourself to Maya or Max (which are the only primary characters) and there isn't any depth to the story which if fine cause the developers main goal was to deliver a short experience and showcase the gameplay.

The gameplay oh boi the gameplay, it is simply fluid, fast paced, easy to learn hard to master, and FUN. There aren't many types of enemies but it does give you a challange and the whole time manipulation is done so very well that maybe other games like Quantum Break should take notes from. The game by itself is only worth it for the gameplay.

Graphics and animation are not amazing (neither VFX or level deisgn or overall assets \ models) but for a school project and as a Demo game it is above the expectations and I enjoyed for what it is.

Please give this game a try and I hope to see more future projects from Limited and maybe even a full fledged game.

Short game as expected of a student project but it's really well polished! 
At first I thought I was missing a lot of my shots by it seems you have to be really accurate to hit properly which was quite difficult for someone that isn't very good at FPS games like me. The game is really fair though and gives you a little slowdown that allows you to react to incoming bullets faster if that shot is fatal.

The boss was quite difficult even if the mechanics are relatively simple. The mechanics are very punishing though! Just about anything 1 shots you but the dodge is very forgiving. Good use of the time stop mechanics as well to allow you to do damage to certain parts.

All in all i'd say give this game a go, it's a good student project that will take 30-45 minutes to clear at most. The boss is definitely the highlight of the game. And hey, you know, it's free! So there is no harm in trying it.

It's a very good free/short third person shooting game to play anytime, the graphics are well done, mainly on the protagonist's time control skills. The main idea of the history is kind of cliché, but the game transforms the cliché part to an interesting experience by particular aspects of itself.

The fight mechanics is impressive, even more when we are talking about a free and short game like this. This is the strongest point of the game.

Strong points: Amazing fight mechanics, Decent graphics, English and Japanese Subtitled, Good history, Free to play, Doesn't require much storage space(1 GB) to be played.

Weak points: The Dubbing is only available in Korean(Original sound), There is no way to configure graphics quality, The subtitles are only available in 4 languages (English, Japanese, Korean and Turkish), The game could have been better if it were bigger (the game is nice but so short)

120952915.review:
PERFECTION!

Movement in this game is incredible and unlike any other.

Combat is dynamic and engaging. Especially rewarding for players with great accuracy.

Damage output is balanced optimally, for the fast combat dynamic

LAST BOSS:

This guy was NOT AN EASY FIGHT at first, however,  the game rewards the player for learning the bosses attack patterns, and maximizing damage output while dodging 2 SHOT/ 1 SHOT attacks. After dying over and over again, your movement becomes optimal, and you are dismantling the health bar of the boss at a steady pace :)

The Boss is very fun to face, even after being defeated by it... and the sensation of VICTORY after defeating is honestly,  one of the best feelings i've felt in this modern gaming landscape lol. 

BOTTOM LINE: THE GAME IS GREAT! 

One of the best I've played... The only crime is its length.... But that"s part of its charm :)


10/10 WOULD RECOMMEND

P/S: I NEED MORE !!!!!!  DLC/EXPANSION Please....  XD

119921039.review:
This game is very short, that much needs be said up front. Expect to be done in an hour or so, maybe less. However, despite this, it is generally pretty well made. There are three combat sequences, the last of which is a boss fight that definitely tests your ability to pay attention in an otherwise fast-paced battle. It has a short tutorial at the beginning, prior to the first sequence, just to get you generally acquainted with the controls.

The first sequence feels thought out and complete. The environment is nice and sets the mood well, and while it is short and somewhat linear, it introduces a few enemy types gradually, and ramps up the difficulty through greater numbers of enemies and less convenient enemy spawn locations. It culminates to a final encounter with hordes of enemies in a way that does not feel cheap or unfair, and I quite enjoyed it.

The second sequence felt... rushed. It lacks a lot of polish. The environment itself looks very nice, but enemies spawn literally out of thin air. With a bit of extra work, they could've been entering from hallways, elevators, windows in the ceiling, you name it. But spawning suddenly right next to you is generally less than ideal. That said, the battle is plenty winnable, and leads into the final sequence.

The last sequence is the boss fight. There are no hordes, no mooks, no subordinates of any kind. There is only the Boss. And he can be rough, especially the first time through. Expect him to kill you a few times while you get acquainted with his attack patterns, as you use everything you have to fight him. The battle feels difficult, but not unfair (except that one attack that gibs you if you don't have both your abilities available... a little overkill, I think, but at least there's a way out), and though it is certainly drawn out, it does not feel forcefully stretched out.

The game is free, and it feels like the beta demo to a AAA title. While there are some glaring imperfections, they do not detract sufficiently from the game to make it unpleasant, and I would easily go as far as to recommend it. An entire AAA title built around this concept, merely expanding the story presented here to make it 10-20x the length but otherwise keeping the game much the same, would likely have been well received. Kudos to the developers!

Humanity on the brink of survival and the only person able to fight against the evil AI and save the world is (YOU)Maya.

"TheDawn" is a short little anime like third-person shooter that focuses on the short but well executed story of Maya a psychic and her team trying to act against the Artificial intelligence, which is now dominating EARTH. 

The game is quite short(around 30-60min) and is really fun to play if you wanna try something new and small for a change in games. I found it to be really stunning, the graphics, soundtrack, character visuals and most importantly the unique skills that Maya is able to control. Everything feels so smooth and well made. There are 3 unique skills like dashing multiple times, slowing down time in an radius for a amount of time and the super attack that I thought  to be similar to something in genshin impact with an extra animated scene. Nevertheless this game is also a bit hard towards the end. You have to be careful and don't rush but play safe. 
"TheDawn" is a short and wonderful game to play and truly a hidden gem.

116132069.review:
TheDawn is a Korean (I think) student project that's been launched on Steam (hence the "free" price point).  This year the students made a third person shooter with an anime style eastern art/cartoon theme.  Apart from regular shooting you get a couple of powers like a time freeze and so on.

There's some really clever ideas here.  The graphics are top notch, these students have outperformed most amateur game developers.  Gameplay is fairly smooth and while it's not perfect, the game is well optimised.  This does showcase how well the Unity engine can be used to make professional quality games. 

Where it's let down is the somewhat confounding choice to lock the game resolution and controls.  Locking the game resolution, and offering no graphics tweaks means the game is a failure, as PC gamers understandably need to tailor their gaming exerience to the hardware they have.  Likewise the choice to prevent users from customising their controls can render the game inaccessible to some differently abled gamers. 

While those flaws render this unrecommendable for PC gamers, the contribution of the students is of very high general quality.  I am certain the students here will go onto to making great, professional games for gamers and I'm looking forward to playing them.

110438901.review:
Really fun third-person shooter with great time-control elements. It's only a single level and a final boss due to being a student project, but the content here is incredibly polished and feels bigger-budget than it probably was. The world and plotline are interesting even if you don't get a ton of it and the boss fight in particular is one of the most interesting I've seen in a shooter. You generally don't see anime themes in shooter games either so that was unique and the character designs are a ton of fun. The majority of my playtime was just trying to beat the boss and I died over and over, but every time I died I got a little farther and wanted to try again. Once you've memorized how to dodge each attacks you really feel accomplished by the time you finally knock him out and it's honestly better designed than the boss fights in most Triple-A shooters. I would love to see a full-length game based around this concept.

Also I liked that the three characters were named Maya, Max, and Blender. I didn't pick up on the joke until Blender came in, but I liked that blender was the bad guy. That kind of UI will definitely drive someone to evil.

So, in short, this has been really fun, would pay for more.

Recomendación de noob: Es bueno, juegalo, es bastante entretenido, además es EXTREMADAMENTE frenético y difícil, una mezcla estilo musou y 3rd person shooter es una mezcla bastante buena, aunque por mi costumbre en los hack n' slash intenté saltar para moverme mejor cosa que en este juego no puedes hacer, pero al menos lo compensa las tecnicas de manipulación del tiempo que son muy balanceadas y versátiles, cada técnica te permite hacer un cierto tipo de acción en beneficio a la situación y a tu necesidad, cosa que le da dificultad y necesidad a adaptarte al movimiento de la protagonista, además cada enemigo tiene un cierto estilo de combate dependiendo de él y sus variantes, obligándote a encontrar las técnicas necesarias para afrontar a tus enemigos, al comienzo son fáciles para familiarizarte con el juego; las mecánicas y los enemigos, parece algo natural, pero es simplemente un gesto de ayuda ya que más tarde te dice lo mismo que en la misión final de Halo Reach: "SOBREVIVE.", y es algo que te hace sentir "ya valió madres", los enemigos son simples y eso, pero algunos tienen su truco para matar, ok, es lo normal, pero suma 5 más de esos, y también unos 6 tiradores, y 4 voladores y bla bla bla, en resumen, es como jugar DOOM ETERNAL, pero con una waifu armada con solo una escopeta.

Y mi opinión?: JUEGA ESTA MIERDA
Mi deseo: pido más historia, que puedas disminuir un poquito la dificultad (sí, en ocasiones se vuelve muy injusto, pero eso lo hace divertido) y ojalá un modo coop

105344814.review:
The game is pretty good for being this short and for free, would recommend everyone to try it out.

Combat is very responsive which feels good, even shots that go into your back make time slow down so you can react with a dodge properly. Though the crosshairs are very missleading, the normal attack has an about 300% bigger spread then it is actually shown on the crosshair and the zoomed in attack makes you think that the spread increases in some way while it being pinpoint accurate the whole time. There is also no damage inpact/feedback for the player, if you get hit you probably wont notice half the time and just suddently die. Just a simple soundcue would go a long way.

The Ultimate ability often decided for itself where to shoot as it did nearly every time an 180° turn, but since it drags enemies in it basically never mattered in terms of gameplay.

The enviorment, the OC, enemies and boss look very well made. Only a few models and just two levels, but hell for just that it looks great!
The translation for english is good, no obvious weirdly phrased sentences or sentences that made basically no sense.

There are some bugs like the resolution of the game being too big, making the HUD disappear off-screen which is pretty annoying but doesnt hurt the gameplay too much. The Boss sometimes gives no opening for minutes, so youre just there, dodging attack after attack for minutes.

The Boss has an one hit KO attack that is very hard to react to when you get to the low health for the first time which feels cheap. The flying enemies spam projectiles a bit too much, making it become a bullet hell very fast (even with abilities). And the AI for the ground minons seems pretty bad as they wont shoot unless they walked to where they wanted to.

Overall, it has some flaws, its pretty good for the 20-60 minutes you can get out of it. And I mean it is free! Hope this will be turned to an complete game at one point, and that the flaws are gonna be addressed.

105308582.review: The boss battle is actually interesting, if sometimes frustrating due to the need to time everything JUST right, like it was with those 'coolers'. However, it's pretty fun all-in-all. I'm looking forward to seeing the full product if it ever comes.

102612330.review: For a 20 Minute game, it impressed me on how fun the fast paced combat would be if there was more enemy variety. I went into this with a bit of a pessimistic mind at first, but i was astonished on how simple, stylistic and straightforward the game presents itself. I found myself enjoying the showcase of the mechanics and the final boss had a few little simple quirks from any other indie developed game, the time stop mechanic was brilliant and executed beautifully, although it is easily abusable since the cooldowns of the game are short, I wouldnt go to say that this is a prototype, but it really was a short experience that i enjoyed nonetheless. I loved the character design, the voice acting (although i may not understand it, the accent puts the world into setting.) I hope that this project can expand into something greater, because this is the definition of a good example for an indie developed game: straight to the point with a beginning and a clear end.

99779386.review: While the end product isn't particularly awe-inspiring or triple A crushing, this game has the barebones of insane potential. If this got fleshed out with more stages, more cohesive story, a variety of weapons and powers and potentially characters as well as enemies, it would be absolutely amazing. I'd definitely recommend giving it a try so you can see what I'm talking about. It reminds me of Soulworker in a way, maybe it's just the cel-shading but the engine and look feels a bit similar too. I'd love to see a game with this type of concept and feel especially if co-op was a core component. I feel like that would make it especially fun. Maybe a system where multiple characters can play and their powers combine in real time to create secondary effects? Just throwing ideas out there. Absolutely great job, looking forward to a larger game.

98296921.review:
A very good concept game. I would love to see it fleshed out into something bigger with a wider variety of enemies and stages (at the moment there are the drones, infantry and shield infantry). I ran into two bugs while playing the game, the first being in the street where the next checkpoint wouldn't load even though I had killed all the enemies (I had to reload the previous checkpoint and complete it again) and the second was during the boss fight with blender where I used Maya's blink ability through the barrier and fell off the map. All in all, a great game and I'm excited to see what the developer can turn this into.

Bonus thoughts:
I think the game could take a lot of inspiration from the Uprising event from Overwatch. There could be payloads to push, points to capture and cores/ships belonging to the AI to destroy, all while fending them off (along with the existing hacking feature) Potentially, there could also be room for a progression system where Maya must upgrade her weapon(s) as you grind through the stages to fight progressively harder enemies.

97850662.review:
Short, fun and free.

You're a human with time powers fighting the machine army to save humanity.  They try to flesh it out more, but there's not much to add when your runtime is less than 1 hour on a deathless playthrough.

You've got a shotgun that becomes a sniper when ADS, a phasing dash with 5 uses and a quick recharge, a time stopping bubble with moderate cooldown, a rewind/heal with a long cooldown, and a screen clearing ultimate fueled by kills.  It's a fun kit, through and through.  It's worth replaying and replay I shall.

There's 3 enemy types and 1 boss, but they deal anywhere from 25% to 100% of your health per hit.  It's hard to get hit in the first place, everything have telegraphs and/or being slow plus your numerous damage negating powers, but you can still die quickly and suddenly if you don't use everything at your disposal wisely.

The voice acting is in Korean (or what I assume is) while the subtitles are in your chosen language.  Makes it a bit hard to focus on what little story is there, so again I advise you not to play for the plot.  We're a gameplay only game here.  And gameplay we sure as hell have.

Would recommend just based on it being free and good, would double recommend if you like ULTRAKILL, DUSK or DOOM.

97272371.review:
[h1]Rating[/h1]
8/10

[h1]Intro[/h1]
Pretty much all you see in the screenshots is what you're getting, three levels of third-person shooting and using abilities and it's good. I genuinely don't know the future of this game, but if this were turned into a 5 hour long game priced at $20, I can absolutely see myself buying it. Because the gameplay loop feels really polished as is, the art direction is great and it makes me wish that there were more anime third-person shooters. But as is, if you want to give it a try, go ahead and do that, especially since it's free.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
+ It's free.
+ Great soundtrack.
+ Good replay value.
+ All abilities given are useful.
+ Weapons have good impact.
+ Great aesthetics and graphics.

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
- Less than a half hour long.
- Lack of settings. There's no way to change the graphics settings or key bindings.
- Final boss has a cheap instant kill attack just before it dies if you aren't fast enough.

97023383.review:
I think this game has potential. Needs more work on the storyline and skill based tree (if any). The game can get very boring fast if there is nothing else to upgrade or change. Think based on the probability of mobbing, the devs should consider any form of AOE damage like tossable ordnance, which could supplement during time freeze. I like the idea that we can do a rapid blast with the shotgun mode (main gun) and the midrange sniper rifle mode (during ADS). But there seems to be a slight non-register in some of the sniping angles. It also seems like the sniper isn't that impactful. Most of the time I just use the main gun. I also found a bug after finding 3 sets of data and you needed to unlock the hidden door. This is somewhere in the beginning of the game. Apparently, at times, you can ultimate near the hidden door and press 'F' to unlock the door simultaneously; the ultimate still works and you can unlock the door at the same time. As you guys (who have already played before) know, you can't move during the ultimate animation. Speaking of which, I REALLY feel that the ultimate animation could be improved, in terms of visuals, actions and length. Plus, I can't see the ultimate build up. Apparently, it just lights up after combating for a while. Usually it's better to check visually if you are reaching the ultimate, so that you can plan your next move. 

There is REALLY too much talking, both in tutorial and main. Maybe could try to work on some way to compartmentalize the information. I would really like to see some sort of class based choice. With that said, could work on separated storylines to juice up the gameplay. I really hope not to see much in-game purchases at the moment. They should try to focus on the possibility of end game grinding/playing before considering other options. 

For graphics, there is nothing we can change; understandable since it's still really fresh. Even with a GTX 1050, I7-8750H and 16Gb ram, there is SIGNIFICANT tearing and frame skips. My fps varies, as high as 100+ and down to between 45 and 60; usually the latter. BGM get boring REALLY fast. Nothing catchy, just upbeat and nothing else.

About the character Maya, there is little about her at the moment and don't know what she's after. There is also little personality, which could be a trait of a robot? Idk because I don't know if she's a robot or not.

Considering all of these, I think this game has potential. You should try it out at least. Only slightly over 600Mb and it's still free (for now). Hope to see more updates in future.

93126796.review:
The campaign is pretty short at the time of writing, but the core mechanics of this game are really solid. You have three abilities that relate to time manipulation and an ultimate that basically just kills everything on screen. Each of the abilities has a good balance with how powerful it is and its cooldown. The only weapon you are able to use can best be described as a rifle with a underbarrel shotgun. They both share the same magazine but you want to use them in different situations. Fortunately, the process of switching between them is as simple as holding (rfile) or releasing (shotgun) right click. The rifle's shots go much further and are more accurate, while the shotgun is able to fire much faster. 

This game also makes for a decent aim trainer since every enemy can be 1-shot in the head and they approach from varying distances and heights. 

Overall, I had fun with completing the campaign in about an hour and a half. I died many times, but it helped me figure out what I needed to do different the next time and only increased the sense of accomplishment I felt at every step

92699727.review:
I rarely thumb-down games, let alone free ones, but man oh man is this ridiculous.

I had to install third-party software just to get through the main menu - the resolution is too skewed right off my screen, there's no setting to change it, and this is evidently the minimum size because adjusting my system resolution did nothing to correct it. The software also did not work, so I decided to live with it. As such, I can't comment on the translations, because it seemed like all of the text was outside the border of the screen.

The tutorial softlocked twice. I had to restart both times.

The level design is baffling, and the sections you can explore are walled off from the rest of the map by arbitrary barriers that only appear when you get close to them - there's almost no attempt to build a path through the map organically. The first level is direly lacking in checkpoints, and you lose the last ten minutes of progress every time you die. This would be less offensive if there was any cover whatsoever and didn't just spawn snipers at both ends of the needlessly long corridor the game puts you into. Losing ten minutes per death is fine if your average lifespan isn't five minutes.

Granted, maybe I should have just gitted gud, but when 20% of my 20 deaths on that sequence were from simply falling through the floor and into the void, I didn't feel like putting in the effort to do that for a game that was actively fighting me. It's hard to get invested in my failures when I don't feel like any of them were my own fault.

I get that this was a school project, and it's very impressive for that, but I cannot personally recommend it from my experiences with it. I spent three hours trying to clear a sequence obviously intended to take under fifteen minutes before giving up entirely.

92346884.review:
This game is basically Risk of Rain but with anime version of Tracer . Fast pace gameplay with constant rain of bullet that keep player on the move and reward those with good movement and smart thinking. No cover mechanic bullshit, just straight to the fun. 
       The mechanic is easy to pick up and rewarding to master. The dash ability have a pretty short cooldown make the already fast pace gameplay even faster. The time rewinding ability which not only heal you to full but also help you get out of some of the most sticky situations and finally the time stop ability that give you those precious time to breath.  Finally, the ultimate which is an aoe crowd control burst that oneshot anything in it's area of effect and as you can tell, this ability is op asf and it make the whole game up to the final boss a cakewalk. You shouldn't use this ability if you want a challenging experience.
      I only have 2 complains beside the optimization issues that everyone here has brought up. 
      The first is that the gun sometime feel unreliable, its accuracy has been weirdly tweaked to feel really unreliable even when aiming but excellent when firing up close. Maybe this was intentional from the developer to force you stay in the middle of the chaos. The second is that the gun doesn't keep firing when you hold down the fire button so you ended up smashing the firing button just to deal some dps.
       Overall it's  a really fun game and everyone should check it out.

92066709.review:
Its a fun demo. Gun fights are solid and the abilities are easy to use. You have a shotgun that transforms into a rifle to snipe distant enemies or get precise shots. The boss you face is easy to figure out but a bit slow. The music for fighting enemies could be better but I like the boss theme. I like the look of the world too.
I understood this game is still in development so here's some things I can hope for.

What this needs is more unique enemies since your pretty much fighting 3 types. The infantry who are easy to kill and carry a gun, the shield enemies that are more threatening because you can shoot their heads unless AI decides to stop focusing on you at times or you catch them with your time stop ability. Your most likely killing them by shooting their shoulders or legs with 2 shots. Then there's the flying bots, shooting missiles or sniping you. Combined with other enemies the flies are a threat but they die one shot from rifle or 2 shot from shotgun.

This game is decently fast paced but it needs more enemies and a harder difficulty. Th replay value is there.
I'd hope they include a survival mode in the future since I like the idea of surviving an onslaught army of robots.

Not sure if this is a game they plan to have only one playable character or more but having different weapons and abilities would also be something to look forward to.

The game is fun, I'd be interested to see what they do in future events.

91807642.review:
[h1][b]Short, but Sweet Flashy Anime-Style Shooter by College Students[/b][/h1]
It’s surprising to see more ambitious and quality student projects nowadays by approachable tools and dedicated talented people. “The Dawn” is free-2-play third-person shooter developed by Korean students of Chungkang College as graduation project. Steam version was then released on late December 2020.

[h1]Hope in The Near Future[/h1]
The Dawn has self-contained story; set in 2033 where the world is in serious economic crisis and artificial intelligence turns against human. Player will play as “Maya”, an experimental subject that escapes from AI facility, but also lose her partner “Max” by AI robot. However, Max somehow turns into digital form in order to guide Maya to the heart of city and destroy great AI ruler as the ultimate goal.
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2483831232[/url]
The story is pretty simple, self-contained, and something you could expect from hostile AI plot, but you might need to read both in-game short introduction and Steam store page to get the full picture. The story is pretty short (two chapters) and plays like the final act of campaign. So, there’s not much room for world background and character development especially Maya and Max. I also personally like Maya’s cool-looking and hybrid outfit design, somehow reminded me of Honkai Impact vibe.

The Dawn features two main locations; the urban area and the shrine. The theme represents the contrast between depressing world and hopeful Maya character; it also gives clear visual for the combat.

[h1]Bullets, Time, and Pieces of Robot[/h1]
Average playtime is approximately 30-40 minutes long which involves shooting arena shooting, completing objective, and defeating boss at the end. Maya only wields one energy weapon, but features two shooting function (aim as level action rifle or spray as auto shotgun). It’s kind of simple, but well integrated to keep flow of fast-pace TPS combat with tight controls and smooth transition.
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2483831638[/url]
Moreover, Maya possesses “Time manipulation” ability from psychic experiment. She can dodge (Space), freeze time zone (Left Shift), reverse position / heal (Q), and ultimate skill (E). Most special abilities have different cooldown, except ultimate skill that require amount of target kills. These elements keep the combat more engaging especially freeze time zone where it can stop enemy movement and incoming projectiles. The game also encourages player to adapt and utilize different abilities / time management based on situation as the difficulty shifts drastically at couple last sections.

I found boss fight fairly telegraphed and fun challenge as I learned his pattern and timing when to dodge and use abilities. Also, a nod to Nier: Automata reference.
[url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2483832014[/url]
I dig into development history; the project went through trial and error and experiment of motion capture. You can notice from Maya’s smooth animations and her credit dance. It results solid and satisfying punchy gunplay that I genuinely enjoy and demand for more.

[h1]Technical / Other Mention[/h1]
The game is powered by Unity Engine, represented in Anime cel-shade style. Good detailed environment (some nice pre-baked interior lighting), flashy special effects, fully-dialogue Korean voice acting, and electro / bass / Asian folk music. UI is clean and well-designed. The game provides mostly solid 60 FPS (minor frame drops when horde spawned) and stable performance without crashes or glitches in my playthrough. 

Some of my nitpickings are lacking of graphical options and key binding (even the game only support mouse and keyboard by default).

[h1]Closing[/h1]
The Dawn is another solid title that worth trying. It’s short, enjoyable, and delightful video game experience that done right as Anime (waifu) style shooter (which I wish to see more or somehow overlook). You don’t expect gameplay innovation in here, but fun polished project from people who love gaming and potentially becoming game developer in the future industry. And I hope for the best for them.

91597256.review:
This game has a lot of potential, but a lot it needs to be fixed before its acceptable. 

Okay so a lot of the problems are due to its early/demo state, which is perfectly understandable, but still deserve to be mentioned. The performance of the game is pretty sus. Though on the surface not a very graphically intensive game (indicated by the recommended specs), it will bring any graphics card, from a scalper or not down on its knees with constant 100% utilization. There's also no graphics settings of any kind, and the settings in general is very vert limited. This segways into the art style and overall graphics. From a glance. it's very bland and deserves to be glazed over, but it actually fits with the dystopian-esque tone the game is trying to go for. It also juxtaposes the color and decor of the "facilities of artificial intelligence" (from the game description), which as of the moment only differ in color. The enemy design is also pretty lame and uninspired and feel kinda like placeholders. The boss is just also uninspired robot + hat + big hands. 

Alright, so for a 600 mb game, a short 1-1.5 hour story is to be expected, which was fulfilled. I also don't think I've seen an AI takeover in a dystopian near future before... I can't really make fun of the story, as it has a total of like 1 hour to build any world or character, so nothing I can say. All in all, its basically just background noise.

Gameplay? I don't know how to feel about it. It's fun. It's brainless monke brain fun. The movements look kinda janky and unpolished but feels alright. If you want to play a game for it's combat depth, it's not gonna be here. The 5 dashes + super fast cd, along with 2 simple abilities and 2 guns feels more atoned for an action mmorpg. The lack of a melee option cuts down on flexibility and depth (a shotgun takes its place, but whats the fun in that?). The dashes allow for very intese dash spamming with no real downside because of the short cd. The time reversing feels kinda useless other than its healing, because its just a more complicated dash but back to your original position. The time stop is a one that I've never encountered before and honestly pretty cool. Unlike the reverse, this actually was useful and almost necessary for a part with infinite waves. 

Oh god. So the boss is relatively simple, just a mish mash of stuff you've seen before in souls-like and rpg  bosses. The actual points where you do damage is very ambiguous, as the boss has so much health that it could take you upwards of 10 minutes if you do everything right. It's pretty boring and its just a chore. 

In a game about standing up to technology and A.I., I feel it might've been more suitable to equip our hero with a melee to compare and shine a light on the two sides we meet in the game. It'd also make a more interesting, exciting, and deep experience than the existing guns at your disposal. (yes ik its one gun, but it has two mode so...). With an overhauled combat system and expaned story/design, this game could be a masterpiece. Right now, it is nowhere close. Just like this game, I have no clue how to end this review, so give this game a try if you just wanna turn your brain off and kill something; its free! :)

You also have an unmentioned passive ability where time slows down if you're going to be hit by certain attacks like lasers and multi-bullets, allowing you to dash out of the way. Your timerecall ability is basically your healing, extra dodge, and [spoiler]anti-game over ability.[/spoiler] A little overpowered. 87398181.review:
This is a game with a lot of potential and a lot of problems. I won't nitpick about the translation grammar or small stuff like that since those things can be easily fixed as the game develops. What's harder to fix are flaws with the game's core aspects, so lets break this down.

The Good:
The time control abilities are fun to use, if a bit overpowered. In fact, it so fun that I still enjoyed this demo despite the fact that there's not much here yet. The fun of dashing behind enemies frozen in time for quick kills, or using time-stop to freeze a boss mid-attack can't be overstated. 

Aaaaand that's where the praise ends, unfortunately.

The Bad: 
The time control powers are somehow both too powerful and not powerful enough. The recall ability is nice, since unlike in overwatch you regenerate to full health after using it, regardless of how long ago you took damage. However, you can only get hit like 2 times before dying so you're basically forced to use it the instant you take damage. More player health and less regeneration on use would fix this. The time stop bubble is amazing in that it slows down the game's pacing just as much as the enemies. Having to stop to place the bubble, dash over to it, and stop inside to shoot enemies is antithetical to the normally quick combat. Sure, you could just place it and keep moving, but the other enemies move like normal when outside the bubble so staying inside means their projectiles can't hit you. A time stop that affects the entire level but needs longer to recharge (e.g. Za Warudo), would be much more fun while keeping the original functionality intact. The gunplay is as functional as it is dull. While blasting robots was initially fun, it got old after a few minutes. The time control kept things interesting, but you're still just shooing waves of brain-dead ai. Honestly, given the character's powers, a melee focused game would make more sense. Or, at the very least a mix of melee and guns (think DMC5 with timestop)

Overall, the game needs more power balancing, gameplay variety and enemy types. What's here is fun, but there's a ton of room for improvement.

87397258.review:
so I like the game. it's fun short and sweet. but i think the ending of the game is rather anticlimatic. The boss fight was "hard" not because it had many uniquely difficult to dodge moves but rather the cooler stage left too little time to destroy , i stopped at that boss stage about 5 times all those times the boss was under 2 %. i also find it a shame that the ultimate was not used at the end of the game or at the boss stage.  The characters were drab and had no other motivation that's from themselves. There's a problem with game design and cooldowns. the bosses hand  swings should be timed to the mc's time stop.i should be able to bind my keys to what i want  like my dash to my shift key.  The game would have greatly benefitted from a melee attack by the main character. the sheld mobs were sometimes difficult to kill give them a lower turn rate. that being said i completed the game. also the bosses hand bugged out a whole bunch during my play through it'd just strike air. the scale was too ambitious if you had told me that terminal was just for the city i would have not minded it.
TLDR; the game has alot of bugs and a few design quirks i dont abide by. The game's writing was also contrived and i feel like the scale was too ambitious. It's a good game with fun gameplay loops. if the game was any longer this would have been a negative review. but it's  a game i assume was someone's first foray or a company's first try, for that i cant help but to be impressed

87290954.review:
So finally done.

I usually don't play Singleplayer Action Shooter, but this game is quite exceptional.
It's a combination of 3rd Person Shooter and Action Ability Skills. I like that you have to find out enemies attack patterns plus timing your abilities to avoid damage. I like the setting and the character model because I'm a weeb, so that is also something notable to add. The difficutly is perfect, not too hard, not too easy. Some missplays are more unforgiving than others, checkpoints are pretty frequent though.

The only thing I would like to nitpick is that I felt blindless fast shooting than precise aiming was more effective, which kinda defeats the purpose of aiming to deal more damage.

Really astonish me that is done by just some students, it definitely plays better and is more fun than other Action MMORPGs.

Plus it's free. Would defnitely Buy and recommended if there is going to be a Bigger Version.

Update: Nominated for game of the Year, cause it has so much potential and best money value overall.

87154199.review:
Typing this to promote these guys.

Enjoyable demo. Took me an hour while intoxicated. Keep in mind, it's free and takes like 40 minutes. For an enjoyable free demo to pass the time, there's nothing to complain about.  
  
Cons:
1st level mobs and level-design are bland, but it's to teach you your abilities.

Story is basically "The Matrix". You aren't here for character development, but hope to see a good story down the road.  
  
Pros:
Abilities and character combat. The abilities to manipulate time are great. The cooldowns are balanced and the movement is smooth. I like how the player is squishy as hell so you have to use your abilities to keep going.

The boss is tough but fair. He'd throw out something new at you and you'll have to get used to it. I felt like I was learning each time I died. That's good boss mechanics. Very rewarding when I killed him.  
  
Good demo. I want to see more in the future. If the devs really work on this, they'll have a great game on their hands.

86379963.review:
Very well designed, characters are very interesting and lead on to you wanting to know more about the story. A few bugs encountered along the way of the playthrough, but it's basically an alpha so this is to be expected.
Some things I noticed:
- The bullet when shot in sniper mode goes slightly above where the reticle is
- It seems like headshots are the only way to deal damage to the drones and robots(Don't know if this is intentional or not)
- When fighting the boss, there were a few times where I would beat the boss, but would have to restart due to death. I would assume that this is due to the bosses damage effects lingering during the cutscene. Also during the boss fight, the corners of the arena could be clipped through.
-When slowing down the bosses hand in the timefield, damage wasn't able to be done to any parts of the hand inside of the bubble, making you have to do precise timefields in order to actually be able to shoot the hands and do the big damage.
- The enemies hit VERY hard, especially the robots with shield. Half of your HP in one shield bash. These were easily the hardest part of the run IMO, as it also took some very tight timing in order to be able to kill them before they shield bashed you(Although sometimes when they repositioned they were able to be shot from behind, thank god they don't turn to face you with shields while moving.

86240486.review:
For what it is, it's a short and sweet game that's wonderful.

Current bugs:
Due to me not having the best computer, running a GTX 950, the street level ran terribly. 10FPS or so constantly. Thankfully the Blender level was extremely smooth so it must have been the environment that wasn't well-optimized.
In the Blender boss fight, I found myself in some situations especially with the many energy balls, where I could not do anything except get hit.
When Blender was shooting his barrage of rockets, it would have been nice if you could see on the ground where they were going to land, to better prepare, as I had a very hard time not getting hit.
The move where he shoots the thousands of tiny balls had a few of them trail me after the initial hit and would not go away after even 3 or 4 dashes, sometimes killing me instantly. It must be the trailing system and a bug where they would not hit the ground after the first dash, so they followed me.

Nit-picks:
I would have preferred that, after destroying the 4 nodes, Blender wouldn't die instantly. It would be better if you had the chance to destroy him yourself by leaving him vulnerable or something. It would feel more satisfying that way.
The game needs more polish but I really can't complain because it is an indie game made by student(s) and you can't expect AAA level of polish so soon.

I didn't really mind the bugs and powered through the bad FPS of the street level because in the end it's still a very fun game and to know that it was made by a student or a team of students is very cool.

Short but solid game. Plus it's free! You can see they've put a lot of attention to detail. The animations are quite good and do not detract from the game whatsoever. (Based on their credits, if they wanted to put more time into animations they could, but this is good enough). Mechanics are basic but very solid and feels very smooth and snappy. I got used to the aiming in minutes and really enjoyed the gunplay, especially during large waves of enemies. Precision is rewarded but even without it I think it's still possible for someone new to be able to pick up for a challenge. Even with only a few abilities, the game makes good strategic use of them, both offensively and defensively, especially during the boss battle. It's really good to see outside of the usual bulletsponge type bosses. 
This game has a good base to build upon and has a lot of potential to expand (additional story, abilities, weapons, and enemies) I'd really like to see where the studio takes this game or any future projects they may have planned.

85211250.review: This was actually a pleasant surprise. Despite being a free game; the controls were tight; the mechanics were well implemented; and the boss fight was just amazingly paced. It's an action packed game that reminds me of Honkai Impact 3, both in art style and gameplay. But the major difference here is the boss mechanics, something you don't often find in free games. The game was dynamic and action packed, and even at times challenging. The game encourages an aggressive play style, where movement and positioning are key. This makes the game even more exciting, keeping the players from getting lenient. I'm hoping to see what the future holds for the development of this game, hopefully it becomes into a full fledged title.

85171447.review:
Ok, Theres quite a bit that I really need to say

When I first started playing this game, I actually enjoyed it and liked how hard it was. I started constantly playing it and enjoyed every second of it, Despite my pc not being able to handle the graphics that well. But theres a few problems I dont like

1. You can easily clip through the map and die, And overall with that dash move you have it can make you even clip through for example the walls where you fight the boss. When you clip through the walls you go through the floor thats there, It isnt even solid actual floor and you end up dying because you fall out of the map. Its really annoying because I was pretty far into it then died, I had to start all over again. The same happened with me when I was fighting enemies, I just randomly clipped through the floor and died. The checkpoints where you spawn back can be annoying to start all over again with something really hard, But I actually am fine with that because you do it over and over until you get it right which happened to me, I only dislike it a lot if you keep clipping through everything and dying. A little note about the boss as well, When it smashed its fist into the ground into my portal thing (sorry I dont know the name) to get stuck on to hit its hand, It sometimes smashes it on me while Im in the portal thing or even outside of it normally. The hand gets stuck like its supposed to but then Im stuck and cant move, Shoot, Or anything and I miss an opportunity to hit it, I dont even die I just am fused in its hand, I cant even dash out, Nothing. Its not fair

2. I like that you translated it in a lot of languages, But theres no point to it if theres no English audio or even subtitles, This could probably go to any language thats in this game. Ive looked in the setting and there was nothing of the sort, That makes me not know what Im doing and overall play a game blindly only enjoying the simple things, Like the attack mechanics and how hard it is. I dont know anything of what the story is and what Im supposed to do, Or even what my moves are called which probably seemed obvious just by me writing this review

3. Sometimes when I do a move that I want it doesnt do it right away, For example the dash which is the one that it happens to the most. When I try dashing sometimes it doesnt even do it when want it to? I do the move like the dash, And I can see the purple but I stay in one place, Then I die unfairly because of robots attacking me, Its really unfair

4. The graphics look ok but the city you are in looks pretty bland, You should add more stuff to it and color and make everything look better, The boss area looks ok but honestly if you want to go all out you should redo everything on how it looks and make everything look prettier and better, This might be an opinion/preference but honestly imagining everything redone with nice aesthetic is really pleasing 

5. Last but not least the settings in general. The settings barely do anything and have little info, The only thing it has is to change the language of the game (like I said no audio at all and subs), And the aim sensitivity and thats it. Id like to see more variety honestly, For example the quality of your graphics, Or even the lighting etc. Just something more

I honestly really enjoyed playing this game trust me, And I could just look up the story myself and see what everything means, But at the same time I shouldnt have to do that. A game should have english subs at least if it has a mode for english, To me I feel theres no point in adding languages if i dont know what Im doing. I know its annoying that Ive mentioned the audio/subs and about it being unfair a lot but honestly its frustrating because I liked this game
I really hope you can fix all of this or even the major small things ive mentioned here, And even if you have to change this game to where you have to buy it just to improve all of this and make the game more advanced or look better honestly I dont mind. I want to see better from this game because it does have potential
Sorry if this is really long I just really wanted to say all that I feel to this game, I hope some of you agree with me too. If some of you want to play this game honestly go ahead, Im just telling you what struggles you will face while playing this game, Thank you for reading

So far TheDawn offers a cool concept of a story and a really in depth combat system. This game was free and I hadn't expected much. What I got was a combat system that challenged me to think about when and how I use the abilities they give you. Each time I died I had the ablilty to choose how I approached the battle, defensive or offensive, fast or slow, sometimes I wish there was a melee attack or the gun held more ammo but otherwise the system is pretty smooth. 
At the time of writing I havent beaten the boss on the Chapter 2 Part 2 
But I have noticed a few bugs that arn't game breaking they are: 
* when dashing down a flight of stairs you sometimes will hit a invisable ramp.
* (could be intentional) when a battle starts you see "system_Battle" it couyld be code or just becasue in the future.
* If move after you press "E" your characture can sometimes not show up in the animation that plays.
*Fell out of the world when dashing on the left railing during boss battle.

This game is really fun and its really a change of pace I enjoy. Keep up the good work developers and I hope my little review helps you out at least with a few bug detection.

Edit #1 The boss is really hard, his attack patterns are so strange and I have no idea what the one where he puts down containers and you have to shoot them from 100% to 0 are. But I died ugh.

Edit #2 It seems I played the game way differently than the creator did. I zoom around fast paced shooting and going ham on the movement system. When the creator's video of the combat is alooot slower than my style.

84725123.review:
STORY
You are the only hope to mankind, which will be devastated from a terrible AI, all that stuff. You start the tutorial, you end the tutorial and you go straight into war. I recommend reading the initial comic, it's not very long and it's the only backstory there is (I skipped it thinking there would be more lol). Besides, there are only two chapters, so the game turns out to be a little shorter than expected (I have already finished it with my 1.3 hours registered).

GAMEPLAY
Cool. You have four abilities: Blink, Rewind, Time-stop, and your Ultimate (which one-shots characters). If you have played Overwatch and League of Legends, think of the main character as a mix between Tracer and Ekko. You may get to use your Ultimate like four times in the whole game, so get used to the rest of the abilities.
There are three kinds of machines: normals, normals with shields, and flying mechanical birds. Watch out with those birds, in my opinion it's best to focus them since they fill the map with bullets very quickly. The AI is a little clunky sometimes since it may not notice you at first (which is great for you).
Your main weapon is a shotgun when not aiming (useful to spam bullets on robots), and a rifle when aiming (useful to get those flying mechanical birds).

WHAT WOULD I LIKE TO SEE IN THE GAME?
- Multiplayer. Definitely. I would love to see it here. These 1.3 hours could have easily turned into 3-5 or maybe more if some kind of multiplayer was added to the game.
- Power-ups. They don't have to be overly complex: maybe a health-kit, more damage, stamina boost... Basic stuff.
- More weapons. The main one is good, but something like a sniper rifle, a grenade launcher or a missile launcher would be very cool to have.

DO I RECOMMEND IT?
If you don't like games with little story and thinking, and mostly shooting: no. There are only two chapters. You will feel empty when finishing the game ("that's it?"). Moreover, there is not much strategical depth to the game other than the three basic abilities and the ability to clear some screen space with your Ultimate. Otherwise: yes. I mean, it's free and it's two hours long at most. Cook a pizza in the oven and 20-30 minutes later when it's done (or burned) you may have already reached Chapter 2. It's a bit frustrating to die over and over in some parts due to the high quantity of enemies, but you can take that as a test of your ability/reflexes.

HOW TO BEAT BLENDER (FINAL BOSS): STAGES AND GENERAL TIPS
STAGES
- Hands (grab or punch): easy. Time-stop yourself, when the hand is frozen go behind the hand and start shooting like you're mad. If you don't have Time-stop, stay back and blink forward (grab) or stay in place and blink to any side (punch) when you predict the hand will start moving.
- Laser beam: keep moving to one side, use your Blink whenever possible, use Rewind when you don't have any Blinks remaining and the beam is close. When he is tired, shoot his hands while moving towards his back. 2 full chargers should go towards his hands. His back is destroyed in roughly 12 hits (which deals 10% of its health), so manage your time remaining as you wish. I recommend Rewinding when you feel like the beam is about to go off in order to win some time.
- Missiles from its back: Time-stop yourself, then leave the zone when the rest of the missiles have stopped. Try to stay on the center of the Time-stop zone, you can still get hit by the other missiles's Area of Effect. You can also Blink or Rewind, but I recommend Time-stopping because of the AoE of the other missiles.
- Two giant purple circles from its hands: it should not be hard to dodge them with Blink.
- Bullet hell (many giant bullets): there is usually a path to escape them. You can tank one if you feel adventurous. If you think you can't escape, Time-stop yourself.
- Many bullets targeting you (little red circles): I recommend Recall or Time-stop. Blink if you feel like a b0ss.
- Last stage (coolers): "all or nothing" stage. Watch out when he is at 15% health or less. If you don't destroy the coolers he creates, you will be instantly deleted. You have enough time: focus on the coolers, shotgun them if you can. They are destroyed in 4 hits if you are aiming.
GENERAL TIPS
- You can aim + shoot him in the head. A full charger is like 1% of its health, worth if you don't have anything else to do. You can also shoot its hands when it has them resting on the floor (for instance, when it has stopped laser-beaming you as I say on STAGES), take any chance you can get.
- Try not to Recall unless absolutely necessary (i.e. you are grabbed by its hand or you are low on HP. See also STAGES as for my recommendations on when to Recall). You can Time-stop more often, but I also recommend you save it for the things that matter.
- You may die some times. The boss is not easy at first. You will learn from your mistakes and in the end you will defeat it.

Good luck, and have fun!

84503581.review:
Cool single-player, 3rd person shooter, with a story line of AI taking over humanity. The protagonist has skills that are similar to Tracer (for those who know Overwatch). 

Character Mechanics: She dashes forward like a dodge, can recall, meaning going back in time and regaining health. There are also voice lines with subtitles. 
Gun mechanics: A very powerful weapon, where you can ADS to make your gun a rifle, whilst hip fire makes it a shotgun. 
Graphics: quality graphics, a bit similar to the game Genshin Impact. 
Positive: free to play, interesting weapon mechanics, great graphics, has its own campaign/story line, and lets not forget it's anime. 
Negative: checkpoints go back a bit too far, unskippable cutscenes, enemy AI sometimes bug out and walk past you, boss has too little moves for the amount of HP it has. 

Overall this game has great potential to become popular with further updates. It needs some tweaks here and there, but the concept of this game is great! I played it myself and enjoyed it a lot.

A fun little game for free.

Although some of the execution lacks polish, and can be a bit silly at times, the mechanics of the game and the feel of it are quite nice.

Definitely would work well for a boss fighting-type game, given how the final boss worked. 
There were a few minor glitches, like the slowdown region not going where it should because I was too fast, and being too fast for cutscene/event triggers.

The final area of the first level had a bit of a confusing mechanic of the hack stopping, but that's because I'd have had to read the subtitles or see the machine to notice.

The ult is a bit strong, which is good for clearing the whole region, though. I'd maybe prefer something along a timestop or a non-cinematic blast.

Liked it alot. Very basic premise of a story, but with how short it was I'm not surprised. Performance was baby smooth, shooting mechanics were on point, abilities while little looked and felt AAA levels of solid. Final boss at the end actually surprised me with the level of difficulty it posed.
Seems like this could be the frame work for an interesting expanded version of the world, hack n slash style but with guns and powers.

My only gripe is that Maya was outlandishly small while still seemingly a giant. Obvious small body but was bigger than certain parts of the environment and on par with the robots. The scaling was just weird is all, not really a negative for something so short.

Wouldn't mind seeing more of this, or similar games.

84310019.review:
I played this game fully, and got through the entire game. Its short, but fun, so i'll write a useful review of it since so many AAA games fail to do a couple things this game does nicely.

TheDawn is a third person wave based bullet-hell(ish) game that takes the idea of being able to gently manipulate time and uses it liberally, with a focus on "dont get hit or die" mixed with "Prioritize targets", which sounds like a cocktail shaker with cocaine in it on paper.

In practice, its better. The story is kinda there, and in such a way that its not too important, but also not in such a way that it stops gameplay forcefully without thinking, which is somehow a refreshing thing to see. The gameplay is simple, Go to area, hack thing, shoot enemies of different varieties in a semi-wave based way. You have quite a few things to do this with, the shotgun which is good against single targets close range and thats it, and the rifle which is good for any target period minus some parts of the final boss and shield bots.

The powers are more or less the butter and bread. You have time bubble thingy that stops all BULLETS (except your own) and enemies in their place, however is countered by drones that fire beams, which arent effected by the bubble. Theres the rewind, which is essentially a budget regenerating health kit, and also a godsend against the final boss. Theres the dash, which puts gungeons dodge roll to shame with how easy it is to use, seeing as it recharges over time but you need to use it efficiently since that recharge time isnt enough to be spammed. and then there is the ult, which i think i can just say "nuff said".

Spoilers from here on so if you give a fuck about the final boss then i'd suggest leaving. Not sure why you care that much though.

The final boss is bullshit, but in just enough of a way that you actually feel bad-ass as you fight it, with a lurking feeling of "i could possibly fuck this up at any moment and its pretty much only my fault". The only exception to this being the instant kill time trial that is the final attack and is utter horseshit with how precise it is. That being said, every attack is forecasted beforehand, which is great cause that means you can actually learn about how to dodge the next attack. Genuinely surprised how many games recently fail to do that but hey... The only major BS part about it besides the final attack is that all the attacks are random, but because they are forecasted, it means that you will be learning what animation means what as you fight him. or die to him, like i did.
Anyway, you kill big bad and the game ends, without much of a celebration in it at all. 

Overall, games fun, and has relative amounts of replay in it if not all that much.
7/10.

84201309.review: It's decent for a free game. The time mechanics are fun. My only complaint is the boss battle at the end being too hard and buggy at times. There aren't any indicators of where attacks are going to go, which normally isn't that much of an issue, except when you have missiles coming at you from above and no idea where they're going to go. You basically have to predict it which isn't always easy. And if you're unlucky that round of fighting the boss, he'll decide to do that several times in a row instead of his much easier to dodge laser attack. Now should you manage to survive despite all that and the occasional bugs (such as him refusing to show his weak point) and get to the end of the fight, you have the boilers you have to destroy in a SUPER tight timeframe. The devs need to add a couple seconds of extra time *at least*, it feels terrible only needing one more shot and getting insta-killed. In any case, besides the boss fight issues it was fun going around and killing enemies with time powers - the game has a lot of potential so I'm a bit sad that the devs don't plan on developing it any more. It would be fun to have a more fleshed-out story, more powers, etc.

84119800.review:
Score: 4/5
Conclusion: A fun game that despite not rising above its ideas and concepts, makes for an enjoyable time playing it.

The Dawn is a short but good game, in my opinion, lasting around 30-60 minutes depending on how you fare on the boss. It has some cool ideas that play with the concept of time, being able to rewind yourself to recover HP or stop bullets mid-air plus freeze enemies on their tracks is fun and simple to pull out, yet is also a bit strategic since you are loaded with waves of them. Controls on the keyboard took a couple of minutes getting used to but other than that it was smooth sailing overall.

The enemy design is made so that you use your abilities smartly, which is a good choice. Freezing the boss movement can allow you to find weak spots for huge damage while your other skills can save you from death or a mechanic. The story is kind of simple and something I find that a lot of reviews didn't mention is that yes there is hacking in this game, but is automatic, you only hold F during it so there are no true "hacking" bits into it.

As a free game, I recommend you give it a try! Is a perfect way to unwind and try something fresh without spending a dime nor getting into a compromise of 40+ hours. You find yourself browsing what to do, give The Dawn a run, and have some fun!

Best part about it is that it's free and although the game is only around 30 mins to an hour long it brought me a lot of enjoyment and I would like to see a game like this with a better budget.

83932135.review: As of writing this review, I've only played around 40 minutes of TheDawn, but I can already see the incredible potential for it. The gameplay mechanics are very smooth and it's really satisfying to chain together dodges, time stops, and headshots all together. The translation isn't the best, but the story definitely has a lot of potential to be fleshed out in a fully fledged game. The gameplay loop is somewhat basic for the most part; hack, shoot, hack, shoot, but there really isn't much more needed for that loop, since the gameplay is so satisfying. It has a certain learning curve to it that makes weaving in and out of bullets very fun, and I see incredible potential for this game in the future. Even if you may be turned off from this game because of the art style of the MC, I highly recommend playing TheDawn.

This game is neat but that's the only thing it has positive for.

The game needs to pick it's places to have dialogue since you half of the time run pass a checkpoint because they have a dialogue when they could have been having it before even getting there in the first place.
Like when you get ambushed he could have said in this cutscene to run away instead of waiting a bit and then saying to run.

Boss ain't that fun, he is a sponge that takes way to long to take down.
All of his moves are some what unpredictable at first glance but later are to easy to doge and not take damage at all.
But the last move is bullshit, the only way you know it's coming if you died on it in the first place.

How it is it's not a good game, it needs polish for something this simple could have been an easy fix.

83683509.review:
This game is free, and has a pretty nice artistic style. That's the only thing it has going for it, and that's why it's so highly recommended. Who doesn't love free things?
Sadly, it being free doesn't mean it isn't a waste of time. 

The game is just bland as bland can be. Your abilities are as follows: Shoot, dodge, heal, aoe time slow, ultimate ability. The combat consist entirely of just dodging around enemies and shooting them, no skill involved at all. The time slow ability is also inconsistent and doesn't always work. The entire challenge of the game is just from the same 3 enemies being spawned over and over again while you're confined to a small little area. 

On top of the combat being the same thing over and over with very little to actually do aside from dodge-shoot-dodge-shoot, the AI is pretty horrible. Two of the 3 enemies will, more often than not, just walk towards a set point before starting to shoot at you. It seems like they're glued to a motion node and can't do anything until they reach their mark. The weirdest thing is that they aren't consistently like this, so sometimes an entire wave of enemies will walk straight past you, other times they'll all function correctly. 

The final boss was kind of neat at first, but it's just the most grindy kind of experience that's harmed by the combat being so lack luster. You just spend 8 or so minutes shooting over and over again while dodging, healing, dodging, slowing time when the ability is up, and then dodging some more. There is also a phase towards the end where if you don't shoot 4 things fast enough, you get instantly wiped and have to start all over. The cherry on the uncreative cake is the blatant "inspiration" from the NieR franchise's specific type of bullet hell. They have almost identical speed, size, and graphics. There is almost literally no difference at all. 

All in all, this game isn't worth most people's time. If you've got nothing at all to do and you're looking for a quick way to kill some time, this might just work, but if you're expecting something fresh, keep looking. It's nice that it's free, but not only does it bring not an ounce of creativity to the table, but it's just a bland experience over all. Smooth animations and a few nice designs aren't enough to save a game that lacks a heart and soul.

83640775.review:
TheDawn is a third person over-the-shoulder-style shooter.
You have a shotgun, a sniper rifle, and the ability to stop time, dodge, and stop projectiles.
This is an interesting suite of abilities, and whilst the game is short the challenge is still there due to the very large waves of enemies TheDawn loves spawning endlessly.
TheDawn is very bullet-hell-y in many areas due to the extreme numbers of enemies and the large numbers of projectiles.
The weapons feel impactful and the robots that you are fighting get destroyed with sufficient force to give a good sense of catharcism.
The main issue with the combat is the enemies with shields, which take abilities, precision, or them not being as intelligent as you to defeat, and feel like they could have been implemented better.

The plot of the game is interesting in a very-typical-of-its-genre kind of way, but also largely takes a back seat to gameplay, which is what most of your time in the game will be.
Despite the games limited size and length your character and the usual support character who talks in your earpiece, are both fully voiced, and the voiced actress and actor are excellent - at least as far as I can tell, since I can't understand them. Thankfully the game has English subtitles, which I am used to and am completely fine with.


If you'd have told me that TheDawn was made by a single developer I could have believed that, for the game is simple and rudimentary.
Despite that, there isn't much to complain about technically, largely due to the lack of things to complain about.
I did glitch through one of the zone boundaries in Chapter.2 once, which instakilled me once I fell off.
In addition I was once told to destroy a "cooling system" that looked more to me like some kind of nuclear reactor, but that's a minor complaint.
The options menu is extremely limited, and the game can be completed in under an hour if you are good.

There is also no difficulty setting, although in truth it hardly needs one, as the game does demand somewhat decent reflexes and precision, especially for Chapter.2.
The main issue I really have with the game is that when you die you  after often forced to listen to dialogue or watch a cutscene again, which gets real old real fast.

Overall, the game is short and fun, with a good challenge.
It does lack replay value, and it's short, but it is free.
If you like shooters then you should try TheDawn.
I look forward to the developers next game, or a bigger and better version of this.

83572331.review:
Although short, I can see the love and care that has been put into this. A little passion project worth admiration, really inspiring. As an aspiring game dev, this goes right up my alley as stuff I'd like to make or be part of in the future.

As for the game itself, the gameplay is basically shoot, dodge, ability, shoot. Although there's no character progressions, it allows for quite a few strategies to defeat the same enemy. Most people would probably time stop a shielder to then shoot them from the back, but I found that if you're quick enough, you can turn around and teleport backwards, lining yourself up to shoot them from the back before they have a chance to turn around again. For being so simple, there is space for differing styles of play, precisely the kind of creative freedom that should attract players.

My only issue is that there is nothing resembling melee combat, but I suppose that's not what this game was going for. It's pure gunplay and it does that well. If it were a longer game I'd judge its lack of character progression or abilities/weapons to kick ass with, but since it's so short, it did everything it needed to right. So in reality, the only real complaint is that this isn't a big game. I'd even pay for that!

Also, wish everyone knew how to do a credits sequence like you guys ^^

With that said, I recommend this completely free 1 hour adventure to anyone who likes fast paced gameplay, a scifi setting, and anime aesthetics. And I wish the creators of this little gem the best of luck in the future! Your hard work has inspired many, including me.

83497120.review:
A small and short game about characters named after 3D modelling software in some battle for mankind.

The game itself isn't bad. There are interesting mechanics at play, although a lot of them feel heavily under-utilized. You play as a standard anime girl who's apparently an AI (the writers just called robots AI) who has to liberate humanity by hacking things and destroying robots, to hack into the mainframe and save the world. For the record, every main character here is named after a major 3D modelling software (you're named Maya, your partner is Max, and the final boss is literally named Blender), so I'm not sure if this is some subtle hate message to Blender users.

The controls are standard shooter inputs; WASD to move, mouse to aim and shoot, and abilites with Q, E, and LSHIFT (you can't re-bind these btw). Your character can't jump, but she gains a Time-reverse which returns her to a prior position while restoring her HP, a dash with iFrames, an AoE slow, and an Ult (because it's 2020) that basically one-shots everything that exists on the scene. Shooting with LCLICK fires a shotgun you can spam as fast as you can click, and holding RCLICK before firing makes the camera enter an over-the-shoulder mode that turns your gun into a sniper rifle. 

There are some improvements that could be done here. In the game, there is only one instance where aiming down with RCLICK is actually necessary (spoiler: it's the boss fight). Up until that point I found myself never needing to aim down as every enemy could be mowed down with a spam of LCLICK.
The Time-reverse feels incomplete, as activating it immediately sets your health back to 100, regardless of whether or not your health was 100 to the position it sets you in. Reversing doesn't reverse enemies and debris around you either, so it's purely a healing skill at best.
The Ultimate also feels like an afterthought. In the final fight, there is no way to use it (as to fill it up, you must kill fodder enemies), making it really just a rechargeable screen-clear spectacle to behold before the final fight.

There are some points in the game that could also use some polish. There is a segment where you have to defend against waves of enemies while waiting for a timer device to count down, but the timer shuts down three times, and each time you must stand in front of the device for four seconds while enemies are free to aim at you. Normally this wouldn't be an issue, but this segment takes so long that if you die while restarting the timer, you are forced to redo the segment from the very beginning. A simple checkpoint after a reboot would've been nice.

I could nitpick about the lack of video settings, but considering that this is a free game, I'll let it slide. For a short experience, it was fun. Frustrating at times, but a memorable time nonetheless.
