83391700.review:
A  third person shooter where you play as an anime character that can manipulate time to some extent. 

She's able to place down a sphere's that can trap projectiles and enemies within it, kind of like in another game, Singularity. She can also rewind time to regenerate all her health as well as placing her back where she was a few seconds ago, like Tracer from Overwatch. Combine that with decent gunplay with a full auto shotgun / sniper, a really spammable dash, and a kill everything ultimate makes for a really fun yet challenging experience.

Nearly everything kills you in a few hits, but the game has a system to slow down time when you're in danger, so it never feels unfair. The boss fight however, is a bit ridiculous. Admittedly I died a lot to it as it has a lot of instant kill moves. Aside from that, there's really only 3 enemy types in this game as the game throws a bunch of them at you.

It's a short game, but do check it out. It definitely has potential to be a full release if it polishes a few areas. Mainly, better enemy AI so they can actually turn around to face you once you walk behind them. More interesting encounters? Eg. More planned out encounters rather them spamming them. The ultimate skill is very janky looking, with the cinematic camera failing most of the time.

The story is okay, it can definitely be improved upon. But yeah, I had a fun time with the core gameplay and hope there'll be more games like this.

83253484.review:
The gameplay is ok. It feels like a rough draft more than an alpha phase. The problem is there are too many bugs that are game breaking. Honestly I am more afraid of the walls/buildings than I am of the enemies. The amount of time of I have clipped through them and fell below the map is frankly silly even for a free game. Be careful in general using the "blink" ability as it can cause the falling through the map, or not even work at all (which leads to many cheap deaths). As for the combat, their are 3 enemies you fight that are very predictable, but they have odd quirks. For one they have the thinking process of a potato, but more importantly the flying drones seem to have infinite range with a laser and homing missiles, which is more annoying than difficult. 

Then there is the lord of Jank boss fight. A good bit of his attacks are instant KOs, which fine because some of them are televised. The problem is the FPS in the fight sometimes go to 10 (I almost thought it had froze on me during the fight, nope just low FPS). You also have to contend with the fact that you are dealing with moves that don't even follow their own rules. Using the stop time bubble to stop his grab attack can cause all sorts of collision issues. I have been grabbed and let go, teleported, and even just knocked all about the stage. There are plenty more things that make this boss less challenge and more annoyance. Can he be beaten? Ya, but I don't feel like trying to fight a bullet sponge boss with a semi automatic gun and abilities that like to guess if they are going to work or not. Maybe add some minor invincibility frames, ability to shoot the orbs, and perhaps not have multiple area effects go off the same time? 

Overall I don't recommend. The game is a glitch fest.

TheDawn is a really short, but still fun and cute game! Combat is satisfying and rewarding, the abilities feels fluent and all have their specific uses. The grunt enemies are unremarkable, with a little wonky AI, but they serve their purpose and provide somewhat of a challenge. The final boss is amazing though, providing a fair bit of challenge and requires you to use your skills very well. He does not feel too daunting or challenging, while keeping the fight intense and insanely rewarding.

The narrative is explained pretty nicely throughout dialogue, and isn't too jarring or overwhelming. It fits with the length of the game. And the artstyle is wonderful too. 

Considering this is a FREE game this is a 8/10. I really hope this game gets expanded and build on - what an amazing start this is. I would 100% recommend this game!

83164658.review:
As a fan of the EDF series, I was instantly attracted to this similar brand of jank-but-fun third person shooter. 

The visuals, while humble, are aesthetically pleasing. You won't find combat design at the quality of DMC, but the offering at hand is little to scoff at. Combat consists of shooting, short range dashes, a small aoe that can slow enemies and projectiles, along with a heal that doubles as a personal rewind or backwards dash depending on your use (think Tracer from Overwatch). There's also an ultimate that's essentially a kill-all-enemies button once fully charged. All abilities work on separate cooldowns. 

With only one weapon present, it doubles as a shotgun when hipfiring and a rifle when using fine aim. Shots are chunky and just satisfying enough. Sound design is fairly good, and while I don't understand the language being spoken (chinese, I believe), it comes off as well acted and voices are pleasant to the ear. So that's fun.

Finally, I only ran into one notable bug that I could notice. One time I had a major stutter during one of the final boss's more notable attacks, which knocked me outside the arena. I had no choice but to walk backwards and fall to my death. Other than that, only complaint would be that the boss had two moves that one-tapped me, both of which felt rather cheap and not well communicated. Oh, and the game wouldn't hurt to have like one more enemy.

Otherwise, a very fun experience overall. The type of non-committal thing you throw on when you have nothing to do and end up enjoying far more than you thought you would.  

Hope the devs keep up the good work. With a little polish, a more robust release could be something really special. 
Thumbs up.

83160938.review: I loved this videogame, now I want to play more of this type

83160005.review:
I'm not a guy who usually posts video game reviews, but for this little gem I just felt the need to do so.

Are you a fan of twitchy shooters, bullet hell games and over the top adrenaline inducing action games?
I know I am. And I am currently experiencing a bizarre mix of bliss and disappointment.

Lets preface this might as well be more of a tech demo than an actual game. It isn't the easiest game in the world, but with a reasonable degree of competence it can be beaten in an hour on average. It is free, of course, so that is more than understandable.
When I first looked at it, It sort of screamed third-grade indie game on the cover, and it sure presented some of the traits you'd expect from one (I had resolution issues resulting in some UI elements being partly hidden, absolutelly 0 graphic settings, localization is amateurish at best).

What I absolutelly did not expect however is the sheer amount of satisfaction I gathered from playing time-sniper-god. The controls are snappy and pristine, while things can get very chaotic (and deadly), the time-slow mechanics combined with your other crazy abilities give you plenty of leeway to cheat your way out of most ridiculous situations. Paper HP and Slow-motion on demand, a gun that packs enough punch to oneshot every enemy if you know where and how to aim, and a ton of enemies to shred through really sold the one-waifu army theme for me. All this does not even gloss over the boss, which is fairly well designed to test all of your abilities.

Needless to say, the disappointment comes from how much I wish there simply was more of it. And I very much want the devs to know that they really really should deliver more of it. I applaud whatever weird mojo they practice and would gladly throw bucks at a full-fledged game should they decide to produce one in the future.

All in all I'd suggest anyone who's into this kind of game to give it a shot, throw your bucks at the devs if they ever release more, and to agree with me on the note that Maya's pretty hot.

83031056.review:
As a work that can be played for free, the story and STG level are high quality.
This work is set in South Korea in 2033, and in this era, human beings were deprived of "everything" from the "AI" they created, and it was completely monitored and governed by "AI with high intelligence". The situation was suffering from inhumane acts.
There, Maya, the hero with high fighting ability, born from many human experiments, challenged "AI" and stood up to release humanity from the control of "AI".
That is the content.

However, as a free game, it is a surprisingly high "difficulty" STG, so it cannot be said that it is for beginners.
Basically, if you are a player who has the skill to handle STG / winning style shooting, you can clear it in less than 30 minutes.
However, if you are a beginner, you can say that it is a game that you can't get out of your hands or feet at all.

It is also important to note that unless the PC has higher performance than the minimum "conditions" of the PC, it will not operate normally.
At least, if the memory is not "Intel Core i7" or higher, or "Rizen 7" or higher, it often goes down for each OS.

In the case of a laptop PC, it is difficult to defeat the enemy in Chapter 2 due to the large blurring of the screen, but it can be cleared with certain STG techniques.

However, unlike desktop PCs, in the battle with the last boss, if the enemy comes out with the "final weapon" as seen in the video, basically you lose.
It is difficult to aim the gun, and it is almost impossible to destroy all four final weapons in a short time.

But that doesn't mean there's no way to win.
The enemy's "power gauge" is displayed on the screen of the last boss, and the point is that you can clear it by giving "0%" damage before the final weapon is released.
The enemy takes a lot of damage, especially when he attacks his "hand", so if he wins by that means, he will be cleared.

Also, basically, for users with high STG technique, it is a level that can be cleared relatively quickly, and once it can be cleared, there will be points where you will get bored.

And although this work is highly evaluated, it should be noted that it is not compatible with the controller in that the operation is only "mouse and keyboard".

Due to the high degree of difficulty and the problem of operation, there are places where not everyone receives it. It's well worth playing once.
However, it is safe to avoid beginners and those who are not good at STG.

I'm not really someone who gets interested in stories and usually like just getting into gameplay so something like this was straight up my alley! You get a cut scene of sorts in the beginning and through out the rest of the game you have dialogue here and there between the protagonist and the other dude (heh already forgot as I was more focused on shooting robots lol). I'm not discrediting the story this game tried to tell, because I actually liked the idea of it and it was intriguing! 

I'd also like to bring up how the boss fight utilizes the ability to slow down time which is really fun (also love the bullet time when you get shot at with a laser, be it the boss or a regular enemy). It was also fun on the boss trying to kill it as fast as I could and somehow I had 1 cycled from the first fist smashing to lasers and attacking the back which was fun, might try and figure out how I did that and time myself for a challenge). This review is just a ramble, sorry lol. Just loved this game and am looking forward to something more coming of this!

82987937.review:
Not gonna lie, the trailer made me believe it was a much more ambitious game for some reason, but either way I had my fun with it.
It's a 30 minute clear game, made by like two people or so (sorry i can't read korean, nor did i look at the credits for longer than 10 seconds), however it offers a fair share of fun.
Aside from the mediocrely-translated "plot summary" and not very ambitious dialogues, which are obviously the worst part; the gameplay was fairly pleasant; I've had to deal with a lot of crippling gameplays for a few similar low-effort productions; and the graphics, which drew me in in the first place, were actually really pretty, not what i'd expect from this kinda niche game.
Really, the story is the only downside (during the lines of "i'm about to break but I'll manage I really hoped for some kinda action twist or a tragic ending, sorry i'm a bad person).
While it's not a game you're gonna commit to over long hours (unless you're really drawn in, and honestly i could see myself doing that as well, perhaps if there was a higher difficulty selection; just for the gameplay) it gave me some unexpectedly fun half an hour of relaxing LMB spam (shotgun mode is too good, please nerf).
Also Maya is kinda cute. 
Bonus point for the boss' danmaku pattern.

82987133.review:
INTRO
As this game was free, I was not expecting much, BUT! this game blew me out of the water! it may only be a half an hour in length, but it was well worth the play through and I will play it again at some point! the game ran smoothly on a 2600x and 5700xt as expected. 

PROS
-WONDERFUL GAMEPLAY, it was fluid felling and had awesome mechanics with the shotgun that switched to a rife when aiming down sights.
-nice story.
-good voice acting.
-enemies are satisfying to defeat.
-in game abilities are unique and make you feel powerful as well as all very useful in game.
-beautiful art style.
-a very fun overall game.
-the end boss is challenging and very fun with a multitude of patters, abilities, and attacks, as well as many ways of defeating him.

CONS
-as far as I can tell it is only voiced in Korean.
-the game is short, very short, I found myself wanting MORE, MORE, MORE after I finished playing it the first time around.
-there is no difficulty slider.
-low replay ability.
-no graphical settings

CONCLUTION
This game was a very short but fun experience with a satisfying gameplay loop as well as enjoyable mechanics. I hope to see more content developed and added to the game like graphics and difficulty settings as well as more levels. Overall, it was a compelling experience that is easy to recommend to anyone!

Times Completed = 2

It's a good game with some pretty fun movement mechanics (it reminds me of S4 league quite a bit, if anyone here has actually played it) -- it's not immediately clear that using your Q heals you to full, but otherwise the controls are pretty fluid.

The combat is not bad but your shotgun feels like a complete peashooter oftentimes and the flying drones are quite frustrating to hit (or you are hitting them but because there is no stagger animation it doesn't feel like you are) but it's fine for what is essentially a demo.

I am not a fan of how the homing missiles can't really be juked consistently, and I am definitely not a fan of the final boss fight. I don't like it because there are large chunks of time where you are just standing there waiting for the bosses next move (the boss is invulnerable for most of the fight) which makes the final fight a bit of a chore if you have to repeat it more than once (which I had to lol).

It's still a fun way to blow an hour and definitely contains some interesting concepts that would be fun to see in another game.

Graphics are ok. There aren't many animations but again, tech demo game so I'm willing to overlook it. The whole thing just needs a bit of polish, that's all.

82929086.review:
TL;DR: Game is amazing. Didn't expect this much content at first, but had my fun and has some challenge to it. The only reason I don't recommend this is because of the bad optimization.

I don't like to use another game to describe a game, but imagine Honkai Impact, but it was a TPS (Third-person Shooter) with a hint of roguelike element. No, I'm not saying this game lacks creativity (in fact, I feel this whole concept is creative and fresh). Not going to spoil anything from the game, therefore I won't talk about anymore about the gameplay. I highly recommend (considering the game size is small as well) to download and try it for yourself.

The only issue I faced is that there is no graphics setting to optimize the game. Rather, there is no optimization at all. Yes, I have seen the minimum requirement (and that it is rather high), and yes, I have at least the minimum requirement. However, for a game like this, I don't think it is necessary for the minimum requirement to be this high. I believe optimization can be made such as not loading the entire map unless it's necessary.

Yes, I wish to see this game grow and have more content. Yes, I will continue to play this game until I had my fun. No, I won't recommend this game to anyone else due to the bad optimization. That's that.

82857280.review:
The movement in this game is smooth, I love it, the way of dogging the attacks were amazing and the use of the abilities  were perfectly used and executed, the cooldown were perfectly balance.

Only issues I have with the game is the flying drones were a bit too powerful, and in the 2 minute hacking section there was no check point in between (A) the final survival hack, and the boss fight (B).

A = Bit annoying when it stopped but enemies still swarm, but passable as skill would be needed to survive and restart the hack.

B = The boss fight was lengthy and tedious with the only spots to do massive damage were weak spots, if it took quite a bit of damage from anywhere it would be reasonable having no check point.

For Hardcore Gamer:

Discard the last two issues, they are perfectly fine for people that enjoy the difficulty in games, having to one shoot bosses without dying, if one did die they need to start from scratch, it's perfect with the weak spots being the most damaging spots.

Ideas that I would like to see:

1 = Add a difficulty option, to change how the difficult the game is, right now it's pretty hard for casual gaming.
2 = Add more options in the settings. (But that one most likely will come soon enough.)
3 = See if it's possible to add more enemy's, variation would be nice, it will increase the difficulty as well.
4 = Maybe a second face to the boss, yeah long and tedious, but I loved it and more of a fight would be amazing. ( >:D Pain I love it.)


Final Note:
As a future game developer myself, I inspire to make big games as well, enjoying seen small games like these that from what I have learned from coding, isn't easy at all, for how much this game has, even though it seems so little, it has so much work and love put on it, I love it I would pay for a kick starter if there's going to be another game made, this game was amazing and I hope you guys grow as a company and make many more games.

82786034.review: This demo has great mechanics that I would like to see expanded on. The boss, however, could have been made differently. My strategy ended up being [spoiler]slowing down the boss's hands or waiting till they were launching rockets or just "resting" and just emptying the shotgun rounds into the hands.[/spoiler], however the boss just has soooo much health that it's just not fun to run this strategy again and again to then later figure how to handle the boss's next phases. Still, it was somewhat fun and it would be interesting to see when given enough time and love.

TLDR I definitely recomend, its really fun, and the mechanic on the boss are incredible ! I love it ! and its Free so its worth checking o/

82725074.review:

82719716.review:
Takes about 30 minutes to clear if you understand the basis of standard run and gun games, feels like there are some odd hit boxes on mobs occasionally but there's no real issue with this. Without your ultimate at times it does feel a bit overwhelming in terms of the sheer quantity of mobs that are attacking you when you need to hack something as part of the mission.

Some people seem to have issues with the boss but once you get used to what the attacks it does are and how to handle them you can clear it in around 5 minutes without any issues. (mostly just find out when you can use your skills to help you, e.g. dash to avoid attacks and freeze time (LSHIFT) ability to assist with getting chunks of damage in to the hands in one go).

For a f2p game it's well made and over all it's an enjoyable game at that. Would love to see more content for the game (e.g. more guns, mob types, zones and bosses - especially bosses)

82716435.review: Una experiencia corta, pero intensa. Merece la pena probarlo, me han gustado mucho las mecánicas jugables. Muy recomendable.

82707306.review: Awesome game! I really really hope that the developer decides to add more chapters and enemies, this game really could be amazing!

82694794.review: Short yet fun, good indie game

82692874.review:
Personal Opinion Review (Harsh review in a way but no offense)
Game difficulty - 4/10, Not challenging, Easy and friendly for beginner.
Control - 7/10, Flexible control but there is still room for improvement. User Friendly to beginner.
Performance - 3/10, Unable to fully utilize the game such as using high poly models instead of low poly models which drastically reduce the game performance for low-end PC as well as unable to provide graphic/video setting.
Story - 4/10, Is just normal and boring.
Design - 3/10, Quite common, plain.
UI Design - 2/10, It's just plain, I'm not even sure whether there is any effort put in the for the UI Design.
Sound Effect - 7/10, It's great.
Voice Actor/Actress - 3/10, What are they, emotionless human speaking with no passion?
Sound Composition - 4/10, the BGM does not fit with the battle at all.
Overall, I do recommend trying this game out.

82682617.review:
Amazing game, short but amazing. I really look forward to seeing something new or updated to this game because its actually pretty good.

-Acer

82680401.review:
Thank you limited for this game. 

A free to play down to earth 3D anime shooter.

MAYA is cute. I'd like to see different costumes for her!

82632991.review:
The Dawn a game made from a small indie korean company
Gameplay   :  [8/10] Great Mechanic with the abilities to stop any movement of a certain area, a spammable dash, rewind a certain distance and heals you to full and a giant Vortex that sucks everything and goes boom.
Soundtrack : [6/10]  Its average nothing much to say about this one 
Graphics     : [7/10]  Honkai/Genshin graphics type its considered appealing for me 
Difficulty    : [7/10]  Its quite hard on all chapters but well i beat it in an hour so you can do it :) I'll share some tips down later.
Bugs           : I didnt encounter with any specific bugs its quite well polish tbh

Now with the game tips.
1. Your gun act as a shotgun while not aiming with M2 but act as a Rifle when aiming with M2 and the damage obviously shotgun > rifle. I am not sure if they taught about this in the tutorial maybe i didnt see it or something.
2. When playing the first chapter you are gonna get overwhelmed with robots coming at you at the last stage where you will be constantly fixing the god damn vending machine. You will know what i mean if you play it. So basically at this stage just go beast mode with your ability L shift[area time stop] on the DRONES and Space[Dash] dodge basically everything, try to take out as many of the drones ASAP otherwise you are just better off dead, REMEMBER to use your Q[rewind you back to where you have been in the last couple of second and full heals you]. Use your ultimate when you stack as many of the big fat shield and normal robots and everything goes boom. 
3. Chapter 2, now the first stage for this chapter is basically the same as the first chapter, you get tons of robots and drones spawning in this big hall not so big actually where you have to kill every single one of the robots and proceed to the boss fight BLENDER. 
4. Blender. You can beat it in 3 mins less or so if you know the mechanics of course. For my first try you really wont know much of the mechanics and i beat it around 15 mins+ Second try 3mins less. See how much of the time difference is? This boss is Dark souls difficulty if you didnt know any of the boss mechanics and gun mode like i do when i found out there is a shotgun mode when not aiming with M2. Its pretty easy tbh just use your L shift when his hand is gonna punch down while charging up you can see its red thingy on his hand and timed it with your L shift to stop its hand then go full KKona shotgun blast on the back of his hand. Same thing when he is gonna swing his hand towards you, just use L shift.  
5. Now on to phase 2 where he gets mad and starting to release 100+ missiles on you. When he does that just find a spot where the missiles is not gonna hit or use L shift. There's more, he also releases THOUSANDS of DARK ORB towards you but you can combo it with your L shift again and stay inside for a period of time and find a chance to dash to other orb and side stepping them, they moves pretty slow in the later orb. Blender also have a laser eye mechanic where you just need to dash constantly so the laser wouldn't catch up to you. When he gets tired of all that he will went into a faint mode where you will need to shoot the red exposing core on his back with rifle mode. This phase 2 mechanics is RNG so sometimes all of the mechanics will happen but sometimes he wouldnt depending on how long your fight is.
6. So thats basically it, when you get his health to somewhat 10% left he will start channeling a full explosion where you will need to destroy all pillar looking thingy on the ground and you have won! Congrats.

Overall its a decent indie game of around 1 hour of playtime, I am sure you can squeeze it to around couple hours of it if you didnt look up the tips of course :D, play it when you have time i absolutely recommend this!
